The results showed that DSS-induced colitis was aggravated in C6deficient mice compared with wild-type (WT) mice, as represented by the markedly greater weight loss, higher disease activity index (DAI), shortened colon length, more severe histological injury with increased epithelial ulcerations, and massively increased infiltration of leukocytes accompanied by much higher myeloperoxidase (MPO) levels in local inflammatory colonic sites.

Introduction Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), which encompasses ulcertive colitis (UC) and Crohn’s disease (CD), is a chronic intestinal isorder characterized by relapsing and remitting inflammation ainly in colon and small intestine (Fiocchi, 2002).
